trans-unit.source: Represents an XML qualified name.
An XML qualified name is a namespace qualified local name in the format of `namespace:localname`.
Because prefixes are only required when XML is persisted or read, they are irrelevant for <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> objects.
This class assumes that prefixes are irrelevant.
It is the responsibility of the user to ensure the local name does not contain a ":".
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> class.
The object created has no name or namespace defined.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> class with the specified name.
The object created does not have a namespace defined.
The local name to use as the name of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> class with the specified name and namespace.
The local name to use as the name of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> object.
The namespace for the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> object.
Provides an empty <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the two are the same instance object; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref>.
A hash code for this object.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> is empty.
`true` if name and namespace are empty strings; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a string representation of the qualified name of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref>.
A string representation of the qualified name or String.Empty if a name is not defined for the object.
Gets a string representation of the namespace of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref>.
A string representation of the namespace or String.Empty if a namespace is not defined for the object.
Compares two <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> objects.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName.Equals%28System.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> to compare.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the two objects have the same name and namespace values; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> objects.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName.Equals%28System.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> to compare.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the name and namespace values for the two objects differ; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the string value of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref>.
The string value of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> in the format of `namespace:localname`.
If the object does not have a namespace defined, this method returns just the local name.
Returns the string value of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref>.
The name of the object.
The namespace of the object.
The string value of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> in the format of `namespace:localname`.
If the object does not have a namespace defined, this method returns just the local name.
